header: Choosing colors for a design project can be daunting. I created a tool to make it easy.

layout.title: A different approach
text: Competitors like Adobe Kuler require users to create colors at the root level. Color Supply uses guardrails to help job-to-be-done of picking colors. Everything the user does is contained  within the bounds of color theory.  So any color palette they choose will be rooted in color theory.

layout.title: The second paragraph headline
text: Another innovation I made was to use SVG's which change color based on the currently selected palette. This helps users imagine what the colors would look like on their project.
